org.jruyi.common

Interface IByteSequence

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IBuffer, IUnit
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BytesBuilder

    public interface IByteSequence
    A byte sequence is a readable sequence of byte values. This interface provides uniform, read-only access to the byte sequence. It doesn't change any properties of the underlying buffer, such as position, size and so on.

    All the methods suffixed with B operate the bytes in big-endian order. All those suffixed with L operate the bytes in little-endian order.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte byteAt(int index)
      Returns the byte value at the specified index.
      byte[] getBytes(int index)
      Returns the bytes starting from the specified index to the end of the byte sequence.
      byte[] getBytes(int index, int length)
      Returns length bytes starting at the specified index.
      void getBytes(int srcBegin, int srcEnd, byte[] dst, int dstBegin)
      Copies the requested sequence of bytes to the given dst starting at dstBegin.
      int length()
      Returns the length of this byte sequence.

    • Method Detail

      • byteAt

        byte byteAt(int index)
        Returns the byte value at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - the offset of the byte to be got
        Returns:
        the byte value at the specified index
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is negative or not smaller than length()

      • getBytes

        byte[] getBytes(int index)
        Returns the bytes starting from the specified index to the end of the byte sequence.

        If index is equal to length(), then a zero length byte array is returned.

        The method getBytes(start) behaves exactly the same way as 

          getBytes(start, (length() - start))
        Parameters:
        index - the offset of the first byte to be got
        Returns:
        a byte array containing the bytes got as required
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if start is negative or greater than length()

      • getBytes

        byte[] getBytes(int index,
                int length)
        Returns length bytes starting at the specified index. If length is zero, then a zero length byte array is returned.
        Parameters:
        index - the offset of the first byte to be got
        length - the number of bytes to be got
        Returns:
        a byte array containing the bytes got as required
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if start is negative, or length is negative, or (start + length) > length()

      • getBytes

        void getBytes(int srcBegin,
              int srcEnd,
              byte[] dst,
              int dstBegin)
        Copies the requested sequence of bytes to the given dst starting at dstBegin.
        Parameters:
        srcBegin - start copying at this offset.
        srcEnd - stop copying at this offset.
        dst - the array to copy the data into.
        dstBegin - offset into dst.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if dst is null.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if any of the following is true:
        • srcBegin is negative
        • dstBegin is negative
        • the srcBegin argument is greater than the srcEnd argument.
        • srcEnd is greater than this.length().
        • dstBegin+srcEnd-srcBegin is greater than dst.length

      • length

        int length()
        Returns the length of this byte sequence. The length is the number of bytes in the sequence.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes in the sequence
